title: Distillations and concentrates: In search of a hidden landscape
abstractText: On the 11 December 1998 bob and Joe Foster worked the final shift on the 260 level of Frazers Hush fluorspar mine in the Vale of Rookhope, County Durham so ending a long history of lead and fluorspar mining in the Northern Pennines. In an area now designated a landscape of outstanding natural beauty and granted European Geo-Park status in 2003 the resident of this industrial heritage is all that remains of an extraordinary convergence of geological and human histories. The special focus of this exhibition of visual works and associated archive material relate to this extensive history.
